item.title: Adventures in Racket: gzip
item.description: In my research, I work with a lot of rather large text files–on the order of gigabytes if not terabytes per file. Since they’re plain text, they’re generally rather compressible though, so it makes sense to gzip them while they’re on disk. The drawback though comes when you’re working with them. There are a few options though.
